author: Scott Duwe, Christian Harrison, RJ Jacinto, Zack Palm
title: Top 10 rarest Fortnite skins in 2024 - Dot Esports
text:
Looking good in Fortnite is one of the biggest things you have to worry about before you jump into a match. With so many skins to pick from in this massive battle royale, you might not want to pick your favorite but the rarest skin youâ€™ve unlocked while playing.
There are multiple rare skins that have appeared in Fortnite over the years, and these were only offered for a limited time. If you have one of these rare skins on your account, donning them to show off in a battle royale match is always a good idea. Some rare skins may be ones players have never heard about before. These are some of the rarest skins you can own in Fortnite.
Aerial Assault Trooper Image via Epic Games The Aerial Assault Trooper initially appeared during Fortnite season one. It was available for 1,200 V-bucks , and you had to reach at least level 15 in the Season Shop before the skin became available. Although the skin is not fancy compared to some that have come to Fortnite now, because of how few players have this skin on their account, itâ€™s one of the rarer ones to see in the game, and weâ€™d love to see if it could appear again sometime in the future, potentially with a rework.
Black Knight Image via Epic Games When Fortnite players think of a rare skin you could have, many immediately think of the Black Knight. The Black Knight was a character that appeared during Season 2 of Fortnite , and was a level 70 reward on the seasonâ€™s battle pass. There have been several iterations of this skin, such as a unique twist on the outfit for Fortnite â€˜s OG Season , but nothing that matches the eerie black and silver armor suit with glowing red eyes. Outside of participating in Season 2 of Fortnite and unlocking the skin, it has not appeared in the game since.
Blue Team Leader Image via Epic Games For Fortnite players playing on PlayStation, the Blue Team Leader skin was another opportunity to grab an exclusive item. The Blue Team Leader skin appeared when Epic Games promoted Fortnite on PlayStation, and it was available to PlayStation Plus subscribers who had access to the game. It was called the PlayStation Plus Celebration Pack, and you could grab it on the PlayStation store. However, that promotion has since been pulled, and the Blue Team Leader skin has not been openly available since February 2018.
Eon Image via Microsoft The Eon skin was initially released during Fortniteâ€™s Season 6 and was in partnership with Epic Games and Microsoft. You can still purchase this skin if youâ€™re willing to buy the Xbox One S 1 TB console, which you can find on Amazon but features a different appearance from the original Eon. Microsoft promoted the original bundle for $299.99, but the price has gone up as the console and promotion have been discontinued.
Galaxy Image via Epic Games A partnership between Samsung and Epic Games for Fortnite brought about the Galaxy skin, a character that looks like they were dropped directly from space. Fortnite players had a chance to unlock this skin if they played at least three games while using their Note 9 and Tab4 tablets, and if you did not have those devices and never played the game, you couldnâ€™t unlock the Galaxy skin. The Galaxy is exceptionally rare because of the time constraints on the promotional event and the devices required to unlock it.
Golden Agent Peely Image via Epic Games For those who wanted to push themselves during Fortnite Chapter 2: Season 2, thereâ€™s the Golden Agent Peely skin. The skin was available in the battle pass, but you had to reach level 300 to unlock it. If you had the time and patience to unlock it before Chapter 2: Season 2 arrived, the skin would be available for you to use. Itâ€™s an exceptionally rare skin because of the amount of time you would have had to dedicate to unlock it, despite how long Fortnite seasons usually go .
Honor Guard Image via Epic Games In a promotion between Epic Games and Honor, the Honor Guard skin is one of the rarer and more expensive skins you can find in Fortnite . If you wanted this skin, you had to buy the Honor View 20, a phone that cost $650 in January 2019 when it was released, and the Honor Guard skin became available in February 2019 for anyone who grabbed the promotional code. Outside of this promotion, the Honor Guard skin has not appeared in Fortnite , making it an exceptionally rare skin and one of the odder promotions Epic Games has done for Fortnite players. What made this skin even more rare was that the promotion was not worldwide.
The Reaper Image via Epic Games One of my favorite skins is The Repear, and many Fortnite players refer to this character as â€œJohn Wick,â€ who looks eerily similar to the character played by Keanu Reaves. Many people believe itâ€™s the best Fortnite skin available. However, itâ€™s important to note that this skin differs from the John Wick skin released in Season 9 to promote the third John Wick film. The Reaper appeared in Fortnite during Season 3 and was the tier 100 reward for the battle pass.
Reflex Image via Epic Games The Reflex skin was created during Fortnite â€˜s Season 7, and you could grab it from the item shop for 1,200 V-Bucks in the Counterattack set. However, another way to unlock it was by submitting a code from the GeForce Fortnite Bundle, which was back in 2019. The Reflex outfit has only appeared in the Item Shop twice and was last seen in March 2019. Unless you have a promotional code for the GeForce Fortnite Bundle, we donâ€™t know another way to unlock this rare skin.
World Warrior Image via Epic Games The World Warrior skin appeared during Fortnite â€˜s Season 9 and was available in the item shop for 800 V-Bucks. It was one of the items you could unlock for the World Cup 2019 set. It appeared four times in the item shop but only occurred in July 2019. Because the World Warrior skin appeared briefly during this time, itâ€™s a relatively rare skin that only a handful of players had who might have grabbed it before it disappeared.
Author Scott Duwe Staff Writer & Call of Duty lead. Professional writer for over 10 years. Lover of Destiny 2, Metal Gear, PokÃ©mon, Resident Evil, Final Fantasy, Marvel Snap, and more. Previous bylines include PC Gamer, Red Bull Esports, Fanbyte, and Esports Nation. DogDad to Yogi the Corgi, sports fan (NY Yankees, NY Jets, NY Rangers, NY Knicks), Paramore fanatic, cardio enthusiast. Author Christian Harrison Christian is a freelance writer of five years who's been with Dot Esports for over 15 months covering Fortnite, general gaming, and news. Some of his favorite games include Yakuza 0, The Witcher III, Kingdom Hearts 2, and Inscryption. Author RJ Jacinto Author Zack Palm Zack Palm has been writing about video games for the past five years. He spends his free time trying to learn about a new board, reading high-fantasy series, or working on his latest DnD character.

author: world today news
title: EHC Thunâ€™s Cup Semi-Final Loss to Basel: A Dream Shattered
text:
â€“ EHC Thunâ€™s final dream has shattered
The Bernese Oberlanders make up a 0-2 deficit against the higher-class Basel, but lose the cup semi-final game in a penalty shootout.
Published today at 10:34 p.m
Thun goal celebration after Fabian Bossâ€™ goal.
Photo: Markus Grunder
Despite the defeat: A calendar year that (almost) couldnâ€™t have been better came to an end for EHC Thun on Thursday. First, the Bernese Oberlanders made it to the playoff final in the MyHockey League (MHL) last season. Despite their incredible bad luck with injuries, they are once again doing well in the current championship. Accidents like the 5-0 loss at home against Frauenfeld can happen. And in the Swiss Cup, Thun knocked two higher-class teams, Bellinzona and the GCK Lions, out of the competition.
They will be rewarded for this during the festive season with the semi-final game against the strongest possible opponent remaining in this competition. The opponent is EHC Basel, the current leader of the Swiss League.
Puck throw-in by Hanspeter Latour
An interesting comparison between two teams that are at the top of their leagues and have one thing in common. Neither club wants to get promoted. Not this season. â€œWeâ€™re not ready for it yet. â€œBut everything could look different in a year,â€ says Baselâ€™s sports director Kevin SchlÃ¤pfer before the game in Grabengut. The Swiss League could soon become an issue in Thun too. Maybe in a year too.
But celebrations can already be celebrated today. Just in the cup. Hanspeter Latour is present and opens the game with the symbolic puck throw-in. In 2004, as coach of Thunâ€™s footballers, Latour defeated FC Basel 4-1 in a memorable game. Can the ice hockey team do the same 19 years later?
Suddenly Basel leads 2-0
In any case, the Basel team take the game and the opponent seriously. You know the qualities of EHC Thun. And he more than holds up for long stretches of the game. Basel is only stronger than the MHL club in the power play, at least for the time being.
The EHC Basel is in trouble: Thun is making life difficult for the higher class.
Photo: Markus Grunder
It is a situation of superiority that gives the guests the lead. The Canadian Jakub Stukel scores. Only 24 seconds have been played in the middle third. Around three turns of the hand, Basel extends its lead. Stukel can once again be celebrated as a goalscorer.
Thun catching up
Thun defends himself and looks for the next goal in the absence of head coach Daniel Steiner. Steiner is currently with the U17 national team at the
World Cup in Finland. Assistant coach Hans Bosshardt is on the boards in the Cup semi-finals.
Michael BÃ¤rtschi only hits the edge of the goal (38th). But then the disc is in. Fabian Boss brings hope back 1:13 minutes before the second half-time siren. Mathys Mojonnier finally equalizes (52nd). The majority of the 1,741 spectators are enthusiastic. Thun is close to 3:2. But there is an extension. Keeper Stephan KÃ¼enzi saves the home team from a penalty shootout. In this respect, only Nocola Christen is successful in the Bernese Oberland. Basel scores twice and, like Olten, who narrowly defeated Seewen, is in the cup final.
Read more: U.S. Senate Passes All-American Flag Act: Ensuring American-made Flags for Federal Government Purchases
Found an error? Report now.
0 comments
2023-12-28 21:35:57

title: El tatuaje del que Aitana se arrepiente â€œpor idiotaâ€ - Famosos
text:
Un tatuaje es para toda la vida por lo que la decisiÃ³n de hacerse uno no debe tomarse a la ligera, especialmente cuando se trata de diseÃ±os que hacen alusiÃ³n a alguna pareja sentimental. Y sino que se lo digan a Aitana. â€œTe conocÃ­ con diecinueve, besos van y besos vienen, para quÃ© vuelvo a ese bar si estÃ¡ frio como nieve y no estÃ¡s tÃº (...) Fue por idiota que yo me hice ese tatu , pero ahora no estÃ¡s tÃº â€, entona la cantante en su canciÃ³n â€˜Dos extraÃ±osâ€™.
Pero, Â¿de cuÃ¡l de todos sus tatuajes habla la extriunfita? La letra de este hit nos da todas las pistas. Y es que el protagonista de â€˜Dos extraÃ±osâ€™ no es otro que Miguel Bernardeau, el actor de â€˜Ã‰liteâ€™ con el que tuvo una relaciÃ³n sentimental cuando tenÃ­a precisamente diecinueve aÃ±os. Por aquel entonces, en ese romance que durÃ³ cuatro aÃ±os y en el que llegaron a convivir en una casa en Madrid, Aitana se tatuÃ³ en el costado derecho la letra â€˜Mâ€™ en honor al nombre de su pareja.
dÃ³nde tiene una M tatuada?
â€” ðŸ³ï¸â€ðŸŒˆ (@_ivlg) March 6, 2021 A la intÃ©rprete de â€˜Las babysâ€™ no le sirviÃ³ con reconocer pÃºblicamente su arrepentimiento a travÃ©s de la mÃºsica sino que tambiÃ©n quiso poner remedio a esta situaciÃ³n. Al poco tiempo de romper con el hijo de Ana Duato, Aitana fue vista entrando en un centro especializado en la eliminaciÃ³n de tatuajes mediante una tÃ©cnica laser por lo que ya no queda ni rastro de esa â€˜Mâ€™.
Muy cercana a la familia Bernardeau Si bien la relaciÃ³n de Aitana y Miguel no llegÃ³ a buen puerto en 2022, la artista continÃºa teniendo un vÃ­nculo muy cercano con la familia Bernardeau que le estÃ¡ sirviendo de refugio tras su segunda ruptura con SebastiÃ¡n Yatra en poco menos de un aÃ±o. Y es que la joven y MarÃ­a, su excuÃ±ada, se han dejado ver por Ibiza juntas disfrutando de unos dÃ­as de merecidas vacaciones.

author: Mirage News
title: Police Charge Man Over Kingston Fires | Mirage News
text: On 24 April 2024, Kingston CIB charged a 37-year-old Huon Valley man with offences including arson and unlawfully setting fire to property. They relate to a series of fires allegedly deliberately lit in Kingston on the morning of 6 April 2024. Around $100,000 damage was caused, and a 77-year-old woman was hospitalised for smoke inhalation - she was released from hospital later that morning. The man was detained to appear in the Hobart Magistrates court on 25 April 2024. Police believe there are further witnesses who may be able to assist police with these matters â€“ they are encouraged to contact the Kingston Criminal Investigation Branch, or Crimestoppers, and reference offence report 740211. /Public Release. This material from the originating organization/author(s) might be of the point-in-time nature, and edited for clarity, style and length. Mirage.News does not take institutional positions or sides, and all views, positions, and conclusions expressed herein are solely those of the author(s).View in full

author: Hailey Mensik
title: As hybrid offices look to offload unused furniture, HR has a hand in eco-friendly solutions - WorkLife
text:
With hybrid work leaving half-empty offices saddled with tons of unused desks and chairs, companies are looking for alternatives to shipping it off to landfills â€” and HR can play an essential role.
Getting gently used commercial furniture into the hands of community organizations and others who need it requires planning, collaboration, creativity and expertise, according to a new research paper from commercial furniture solutions company Installnet and Bard Collegeâ€™s MBA program in sustainability. Doing so also benefits from the buy-in of company leaders and employees, with HR often the common link, suggested Dale Ewing, CEO of Installnet.
â€œOne of the biggest challenges is thinking that itâ€™s easier than it is. A lot of companies out there say they can do this, and most donâ€™t do it well,â€ said Dale Ewing, CEO of Installnet, which has a full-time outreach team that partners with clients to get unwanted items like desks, chairs and conference tables into the hands of those who most need it.
Beyond community service and helping the environment, such projects can be a way for employees to feel more connected, Ewing noted. â€œFrom an HR standpoint, you talk about engagement, you talk about culture, you talk about purpose and having a real connection to something thatâ€™s really great,â€ he said. â€œThereâ€™s a real value for employees to be involved.â€
â€œFrom an HR standpoint, you talk about engagement, you talk about culture, you talk about purpose and having a real connection to something thatâ€™s really great. Thereâ€™s a real value for employees to be involved.â€ Dale Ewing, CEO of Installnet. Since 2012, Installnetâ€™s Ecoserv program has diverted more than 52 million pounds of waste from landfills to groups in more than 3,200 communities. The donations help local nonprofits, schools, first responders and others devote more resources to their missions and reduce greenhouse gas emissions that worsen climate change.
Each year, more than 146 million tons of solid waste goes to landfills in the U.S., generating dangerous methane gas emissions that worsen climate change â€” the equivalent of 20.3 million passenger cars on the road, according to the EPA. An estimated 9 million tons, close to half of that waste, is furniture.
The paper cites several examples of decommission projects that successfully matched unused furniture and other assets to community organizations. In Oregon and Maryland, for example, 90,000 pieces of furniture in two warehouses were dispersed across six weeks via resale and donations, keeping it out of the public dump.
Dave Corsones, president of MOI, an office furniture dealer based in Baltimore, related that when refreshing its home base, it ended up with perfectly good desks, chairs and other materials people could still make use of â€” even if it meant more effort on the companyâ€™s part. â€œRather than hitting the easy button and just tearing it all down and sending it off to a landfill, we wanted to figure out how to try and do our very best to divert everything through a combination of employees, sale, donation and efficient recycling,â€ he said.
â€œRather than hitting the easy button and just tearing it all down and sending it off to a landfill, we wanted to figure out how to try and do our very best to divert everything through a combination of employees, sale, donation and efficient recycling." Dave Corsones, president of MOI, an office furniture dealer based in Baltimore. The result: MOI, with the aid of Installnet, diverted 22 tons of furniture to local nonprofits like the Baltimore City Schools, Habitat for Humanity and Bridges Baltimore.
It wasnâ€™t just the right thing to do, he said â€” it was smart business, according to Corsones, who called it â€œa really great opportunity for us to put the goals we had as an organization sustainability-wise into practice.â€
Rachel Lazo, chief of staff at Bridges Baltimore, said the donation was instrumental in helping the nonprofit, which serves local youth, expand its offices and meeting spaces. â€œWe have to fundraise for every dollar in our operating budget, every year,â€ she explained. â€œIf we had to buy furniture it would affect what we put toward programs and services. Weâ€™re serving 440 young people, and we want our budget to go to serving those 440 young people.â€
She added that the used furniture â€œwill see a long second life here. Iâ€™m talking to you from behind my donated desk right now, and I love it.â€

author: Greta Weber
title: Vandalismus an Grundschule Nortorf: Kann VideoÃ¼berwachung helfen?
text:
Nach Vandalismus an der Grundschule: Kann auch in Nortorf VideoÃ¼berwachung helfen?
Hausmeister Michael Brandt und Schulleiterin Astrid KrÃ¼ger sind genervt von der "sinnlosen" ZerstÃ¶rtungswut.
Quelle: Greta Weber
Nortorf. SchÃ¶nberg, SchÃ¶nkirchen, Heikendorf, Kiel â€“ und bald auch Nortorf? Aufgrund von Vandalismus wird an immer mehr Schulen Ã¼ber eine mÃ¶gliche VideoÃ¼berwachung diskutiert.
Dass auÃŸerhalb der Schulzeiten Menschen auf dem Schulhof herumlungern, ist nichts Neues, doch in letzter Zeit hÃ¤ufen sich die FÃ¤lle von Vandalismus: Immer wieder wurden an der Grundschule Nortorf Scheiben eingeworfen, den Holzpferden auf dem Schulhof wurden die KÃ¶pfe abgeschlagen, und zuletzt wurde das Fahrrad einer Lehrerin vÃ¶llig demoliert aufgefunden.
â€žSowas ist doch wirklich total sinnlosâ€œ, sagt Schulleiterin Astrid KrÃ¼ger. Inzwischen passiere gefÃ¼hlt fast jedes Wochenende etwas. â€žAuch die Kinder kÃ¶nnen das Ã¼berhaupt nicht verstehen, dass jemand ihren Schulhof so demoliert.â€œ
Glasscherben, kaputte Fenster, zerstÃ¶rte Holzpferde: Immer wieder Vandalismus an der Grundschule Nortorf
Hausmeister Michael Brandt dreht montagmorgens immer eine Kontrollrunde Ã¼ber den Schulhof, ihm fallen die neuesten Vandalismus-FÃ¤lle also meist zuerst auf. AuÃŸerdem sammelt er jedes Mal eine ganze Menge Glasscherben auf.
â€žSchon zwei- oder dreimal sind die Pferde jetzt kaputtgemacht wordenâ€œ, erzÃ¤hlt er. â€žMindestens alle zwei Wochen ist irgendwas.â€œ UnzÃ¤hlige kaputte Fenster hat er schon Polizei und Stadt gemeldet â€“ Letzterer gehÃ¶rt das SchulgebÃ¤ude.
Eine Lehrerin lieÃŸ ihr Fahrrad Ã¼ber Nacht an der Schule stehen. Das ist das Ergebnis: Es ist vÃ¶llig ramponiert.
Quelle: Greta Weber
Seit vier Jahren arbeitet er an der Grundschule. In dem Zeitraum hat er schon diverse BÃ¤nke entfernt, die an regengeschÃ¼tzten Stellen standen, um den Aufenthalt auf dem Schulhof weniger attraktiv zu machen.
Auch die Polizei habe schon vermehrt nach dem Rechten auf dem Schulhof gesehen â€“ immerhin liegt die Polizeistation direkt neben der Grundschule. Geholfen hat es bisher nicht.
VideoÃ¼berwachung gegen Vandalismus? Nortorf will MÃ¶glichkeiten prÃ¼fen
Jetzt soll geprÃ¼ft werden, ob eine VideoÃ¼berwachung auf dem GelÃ¤nde mÃ¶glich ist. Das kÃ¶nnte einerseits abschreckend wirken, andererseits bei der AufklÃ¤rung der SchadensfÃ¤lle helfen. â€žWir informieren uns gerade Ã¼ber die Kosten und die einzuhaltenden Vorschriftenâ€œ, erklÃ¤rte Nortorfs BÃ¼rgermeister Torben Ackermann (CDU) diese Woche in der Stadtverordnetenversammlung.
Denn klar ist auch: Wenn es um VideoÃ¼berwachung geht, mÃ¼ssen Richtlinien in Sachen Datenschutz eingehalten werden. Welche Interessen gilt es hier gegeneinander aufzuwiegen?
â€žNatÃ¼rlich ist eine Ãœberwachungskamera ein heikles Themaâ€œ, bestÃ¤tigt auch die Schulleiterin. Die Kameras dÃ¼rften natÃ¼rlich nur zu bestimmten Zeiten aufzeichnen, um keine Datenschutzrechte zu verletzen.
Anderswo, wo schon seit Jahren Kameras hÃ¤ngen, ist diese Frage auch nachtrÃ¤glich weiter diskutiert worden. Zum Beispiel in SchÃ¶nkirchen (ebenfalls Kreis PlÃ¶n), wo seit Jahren Kameras am Schulzentrum angebracht sind. Die gleiche Diskussion fÃ¼hrt man auch in der Gemeinde Heikendorf im Kreis PlÃ¶n.
Immer mehr Beschwerden wegen VideoÃ¼berwachung in SH
Da Videokameras immer weiter verbreitet sind, steigen auch in Schleswig-Holstein die StreitfÃ¤lle zu dem Thema an. Beim UnabhÃ¤ngigen Landeszentrum fÃ¼r Datenschutz gingen im vergangenen Jahr 352 Beschwerden wegen VideoÃ¼berwachung ein.
Dass VideoÃ¼berwachung durchaus etwas bringen kann, zeigt sich Jahr fÃ¼r Jahr in NeumÃ¼nster, wo seit 2023 Kameras aufzeichnen, was im Park Klosterinsel vor sich geht. Das steigere nicht nur das Sicherheitsbewusstsein der Menschen, sondern wirke auch vorbeugend und helfe bei der Strafverfolgung, heiÃŸt es aus NeumÃ¼nster.
Sobald klar ist, was in Sachen VideoÃ¼berwachung an der Grundschule Nortorf mÃ¶glich ist, wird die Politik die endgÃ¼ltige Entscheidung zu fÃ¤llen haben. Immerhin fallen hier auch Kosten an. Aber zurzeit muss eben auch regelmÃ¤ÃŸig ein Glaser kommen, um immer wieder neue Scheiben einzusetzen.
KN

author: El PeriÃ³dico
title: Amazon fa una oferta per comprar la filial de TikTok als EUA
text:
Tecnologia
Amazon fa una oferta per comprar la filial de TikTok als EUA
Bezos presenta la proposta pocs dies abans no expiri el termini per evitar el tancament
El gegant tecnolÃ²gic Amazon ha presentat una oferta dâ€™Ãºltim minut per adquirir la filial nord-americana de TikTok, segons va revelar ahir The New York Times i van confirmar fonts de la Casa Blanca a lâ€™agÃ¨ncia Reuters. Lâ€™oferta de la companyia de Jeff Bezos se sabia quan faltaven pocs dies perquÃ¨, aquest dissabte, venci el termini perquÃ¨ la propietÃ ria xinesa de lâ€™aplicaciÃ³ de vÃ­deos curts, ByteDance, es desprengui de la plataforma. Altrament, TikTok hauria de cessar totes les operacions que du a terme als EUA.
TambÃ© van presentar una oferta per la xarxa social la start-up Zoop, dirigida per Tim Stokely, el fundador dâ€™OnlyFans, i la fundaciÃ³ Hbar, que administra la tresoreria de la xarxa de criptomonedes Hedera. Aquestes dues firmes van informar de lâ€™oferta ahir. "La nostra aposta per TikTok no consisteix nomÃ©s a canviar la propietat, sinÃ³ a crear un nou paradigma en quÃ¨ tant els creadors com les seves comunitats es beneficiÃ¯n del valor que generin", va explicar a lâ€™agÃ¨ncia Reuters RJ Phillips, cofundador de Zoop.
Precisament ahir el president nord-americÃ , Donald Trump, va encapÃ§alar una reuniÃ³ a la Casa Blanca en la qual va analitzar diferents ofertes per a la venda de lâ€™aplicaciÃ³ amb 170 milions dâ€™usuaris nord-americans. Dâ€™acord amb les cadenes NBC i CBS News, que esmentaven fonts de lâ€™AdministraciÃ³, Trump tenia previst parlar amb els seus assessors sobre les propostes que sâ€™havien presentat.
NotÃ­cies relacionadesSeguretat nacional
Si no es consuma la venda, entrarÃ  en vigor una llei aprovada pel CongrÃ©s lâ€™any passat que obligaria lâ€™app a cessar les operacions als EUA alÂ·legant preocupacions de seguretat nacional per la seva vinculaciÃ³ amb la Xina. A mÃ©s dâ€™Amazon, entre els possibles inversors interessats hiha Blackstone i Oracle, i altres firmes de capital privat, capital de risc i importants actors del sector tecnolÃ²gic, segons la CBS.

author: Tanja Banner
title: Gefahr aus dem Erdorbit: Warum Weltraumschrott immer mehr zur Bedrohung wird
text:
